page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: There are no major roads in this block except for a 1km stretch of the A2 and a small section of the B2065, Elham Valley road. The few roads that exist are one-vehicle wide, with passing places, leading to outlying farms and small villages to the west. No public transport runs across this area. The railway closed in 1946. A Bus Service, 617,Canterbury/Folkestone, runs hourly in both directions, Monday - Saturday, and will stop on the outskirts of Bishopsbourne and Kingston. Canterbury /Dover,615, and Canterbury/Folkestone, 616, are also available to Bishops- bourne on the B2065 before turning on- to the A2, missing Kingston. Because there is a lack of public transport serving the communities directly, most families have a car but despite this fact, there are no garages or petrol stations in this block.
